metadata.description: The friendly name for the workbook that is used in the Gallery or Saved List.  This name must be unique within a resource group.
The gallery that the workbook will been shown under. Supported values include workbook, tsg, etc. Usually, this is 'workbook'
The id of resource instance to which the workbook will be associated
The unique guid for this workbook instance

content.json:
## Vulnerabilities by CVE IDs

This workbook shows vulnerabilities found by Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management on machines that are protected by Microsoft Defender for Servers. For more information about integrating the vulnerability management solution into Microsoft Defender for Cloud, please visit [this documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/defender-for-cloud/deploy-vulnerability-assessment-tvm).

parameters.name: vasolution
parameters.label: VA Solution
parameters.description: Please select the VA solution you are using in your environment

parameters.name: info
parameters.label: Additional information
parameters.description: Show additional information for this workbook

content.json:
## How to use the parameters

|Parameter|Description|
|---|---|---|
| Subscription(s) | Select one, several, or all subscriptions in your environment. The workbook will use this filter to display vulnerabilities according to the selected scope. |
| Severity | Vulnerabilities are measured in low, medium, and high severity. Select any combination of vulnerabilities you want to display in this workbook. |
| VA Solution | Microsoft Defender for Servers allows you to deploy and integrate Qualys, or Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management (TVM). Both solutions provide different information, so please select the VA solution you have deployed in your environment. |
| Additional information | Shows this and additional information about this workbook. |

## Release notes

|Version|Description|Date|
|---|---|---|
|v1.0|initial release, public availability of Defender for Cloud CVE dashboard|7/20/2022|

In the *Vulnerabilities by CVE ID* section, the workbook shows all CVE IDs based on your subscription and severity selection on top of the workbook. The **Amount of CVE IDs by severity** pie chart shows the total number of unique CVE IDs to be addressed in your environment, grouped by severity, while the **List of CVE IDs** table shows details, including CVE IDs, CVSS, Severity, and other relevant information. When selecting one of the rows in this table, two additional tables will appear underneath: **Affected machines by CVE ID** which will show all machines that are affected by vulnerabilities which the CVE ID you selected belongs to, and **Affected software by CVE ID**, which shows the software this particular vulnerability applies to.

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, Source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source), severityFilter = tostring("{severity}")
| where status == 'Unhealthy'
| where Source == "Microsoft threat and vulnerability management"
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend CVEID = tostring(cve['title']),
    severity = tostring(cve['severity'])
| where severityFilter has severity
| summarize CVEs = dcount(CVEID) by severity
content.title: Amount of CVE IDs by severity

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project Resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)), ResourceGroup = trim_end("/",extract(".*resourceGroups/(.+?)/",0,id)), ResourceType = tolower(split(id,"/").[6]), subscriptionId, status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), VulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), description = tostring(parse_json(properties).displayName), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, SoftwareVendor = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVendor), SoftwareName = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareName), SoftwareVersion = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVersion), Source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source),  severityFilter = tostring("{severity}")
| where status == 'Unhealthy'
| where Source == "Microsoft threat and vulnerability management"
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend severity = tostring(cve['severity']),
    publishedDate = todatetime(cve['publishedDate']),
    lastModifiedDate = todatetime(cve['lastModifiedDate'])
| where severityFilter has severity
| summarize affectedMachines = dcount(Resource) by CVEID = tostring(cve['title']), cvssScore = todouble(cve['cvssScore']), severity, description = tostring(cve['description']), format_datetime(publishedDate, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm'), format_datetime(lastModifiedDate, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm'), hasPublicExploit = tostring(cve['hasPublicExploit']), isExploitVerified = tostring(cve['isExploitVerified']), exploitabilityLevel = tostring(cve['exploitabilityLevel'])
| order by cvssScore, affectedMachines
content.title: List of CVE IDs

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project Resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)), ResourceGroup = tolower(trim_end("/",extract(".*resourceGroups/(.+?)/",0,id))), subscriptionId, ResourceType = tolower(split(id,"/").[6]), status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), VulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), description = tostring(parse_json(properties).displayName), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, SoftwareVendor = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVendor), SoftwareName = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareName), SoftwareVersion = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVersion), Source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source)
| where cve has tostring(parse_json('{CVEID}'))
| summarize affectedSoftware = make_list(SoftwareName) by Resource, ResourceGroup, subscriptionId
content.title: Affected machines by CVE ID

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)), resourceGroup = tolower(trim_end("/",extract(".*resourceGroups/(.+?)/",0,id))), subscriptionId, resourceType = tolower(split(id,"/").[6]), status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), description = tostring(parse_json(properties).displayName), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, softwareVendor = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVendor), softwareName = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareName), softwareVersion = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVersion), source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source)
| where cve has tostring(parse_json('{CVEID}'))
| summarize affectedMachines = make_list(resource) by softwareName, softwareVendor, softwareVersion, description, vulnId
content.title: Affected software by CVE ID

content.json:
In the *Vulnerabilities by machine* section, the workbook shows machines in subscriptions which are affected by open vulnerabilities. The **Amount of vulnerabilities by machine** table shows affected machines and the amount of open vulnerabilities, grouped by subscriptions. When selecting one row from this table, the **Discovered vulnerabilities per selected resource** table appears. This table contains a list of all vulnerabilities, including Vulnerability ID and affected software, which have been found on the machine you selected.
When selecting one of the vulnerabilities, the **Total number of CVEs in selected vulnerability** pie chart, and the **CVEs per vulnerability ID** table appear. The pie chart shows the total number of CVE IDs in the vulnerability you selected, including severity. The table shows details to these CVEs based on the selected Vulnerability ID.

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), subscriptionId, status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, softwareName = tostring(parse_json(properties.additionalData.softwareName)), source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source), vulnId = tostring(properties.id), severityFilter = tostring("{severity}")
| where status == 'Unhealthy'
| where source == "Microsoft threat and vulnerability management"
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend CVEID = tostring(cve['title']),
    severity = tostring(cve['severity'])
| where severityFilter has severity
| summarize vulnerabilities = dcount(vulnId) by tostring(resourceId), subscriptionId | order by vulnerabilities
content.title: Amount of vulnerabilities by machine

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), vulnId = tostring(properties.id), softwareName = tostring(parse_json(properties.additionalData.softwareName))
| where resourceId == "{resourceId}"
content.title: Discovered vulnerabilities per selected resource

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend CVEID = tostring(cve['title']),
    severity = tostring(cve['severity'])
| where resourceId == "{resourceId}"
| where vulnId == "{vulnId}"
| summarize count() by severity
content.title: Total number of CVEs in selected vulnerability

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend publishedDate = todatetime(cve['publishedDate']),
    lastModifiedDate = todatetime(cve['lastModifiedDate'])
| where vulnId == "{vulnId}" and resourceId == "{resourceId}"
| project vulnId, CVEID = tostring(cve['title']), cvssScore = todouble(cve['cvssScore']), severity = tostring(cve['severity']), description = tostring(cve['description']), format_datetime(publishedDate, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm'), format_datetime(lastModifiedDate, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm'), isExploitVerified = tostring(cve['isExploitVerified']), hasPublicExploit = tostring(cve['hasPublicExploit']), exploitabilityLevel = tostring(cve['exploitabilityLevel'])
| order by cvssScore

//| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), vulnId = tostring(properties.id), softwareName = tostring(parse_json(properties.additionalData.softwareName))
//| where vulnId == "{vulnId}"
content.title: CVEs per vulnerability ID

content.json: In the *Vulnerabilities by CVE ID* section, the workbook shows all CVE IDs based on your subscription and severity selection on top of the workbook. The **Amount of CVE IDs by severity** pie chart shows the total number of unique CVE IDs to be addressed in your environment, grouped by severity, while the **List of CVE IDs** table shows details, including CVE IDs, CVSS, Severity, and other relevant information. When selecting one of the rows in this table, two additional tables will appear underneath: **Affected machines by CVE ID** which will show all machines that are affected by vulnerabilities which the CVE ID you selected belongs to, and **Vulnerability details**, which shows more details about this vulnerability.

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| extend source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source)
| where source == "Built-in Qualys vulnerability assessment"
| project cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve,
    severity = tostring(properties.status.severity),
    severityFilter = tostring("{severity}"),
    status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code)
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| where severityFilter has severity and status == "Unhealthy"
| summarize CVEs = dcount(CVEID = tostring(cve['title'])) by severity
content.title: Amount of CVE IDs by severity

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| extend source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source)
| where source == "Built-in Qualys vulnerability assessment"
| project resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)),
    description = tostring(properties.description),
    publishedTime = todatetime(properties.additionalData.publishedTime),
    patchable = tostring(properties.additionalData.patchable),
    cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve,
    cvss2 = tostring(properties.additionalData.cvss.['2.0'].base),
    cvss3 = tostring(properties.additionalData.cvss.['3.0'].base),
    severity = tostring(properties.status.severity),
    impact = tostring(properties.impact),
    severityFilter = tostring("{severity}"),
    vulnId = tostring(properties.id),
    status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code)
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| where severityFilter has severity and status == "Unhealthy"
| summarize affectedMachines = dcount(resource) by CVEID = tostring(cve['title']), cvss2, cvss3, severity, description, format_datetime(publishedTime, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm'), patchable, impact, vulnId
| order by cvss2, cvss3, affectedMachines
content.title: List of CVE IDs

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)), resourceGroup = tolower(trim_end("/",extract(".*resourceGroups/(.+?)/",0,id))), subscriptionId, cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve
| where cve has tostring(parse_json('{CVEID}'))
| summarize by resource, resourceGroup, subscriptionId
content.title: Affected machines by CVE ID

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| extend resource = tolower(extract("([\\s\\S]*?)(/providers/Microsoft.Security.*)",1,id)), vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), description = tostring(parse_json(properties).displayName), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, softwareVendor = tostring(properties.additionalData.softwareVendor), threat = tostring(properties.additionalData.threat)
| where cve has tostring(parse_json('{CVEID}'))
| summarize affectedMachines = make_list(resource) by description, threat, vulnId
content.title: Vulnerability details

content.json:
In the *Vulnerabilities by machine* section, the workbook shows machines in subscriptions which are affected by open vulnerabilities. The **Amount of vulnerabilities by machine** table shows affected machines and the amount of open vulnerabilities, grouped by subscriptions. When selecting one row from this table, the **Discovered vulnerabilities per selected resource** table appears. This table contains a list of all vulnerabilities, including Vulnerability ID and affected software, which have been found on the machine you selected.
When selecting one of the vulnerabilities, the **Total number of CVEs in selected vulnerability** pie chart, and the **CVEs per vulnerability ID** table appear. The pie chart shows the total number of CVE IDs in the vulnerability you selected, including severity. The table shows details to these CVEs based on the selected Vulnerability ID.

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), subscriptionId, status = tostring(parse_json(properties).status.code), source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source), vulnId = tostring(properties.id)
| where status == 'Unhealthy' and source == "Built-in Qualys vulnerability assessment"
| summarize vulnerabilities = dcount(vulnId) by tostring(resourceId), subscriptionId | order by vulnerabilities
content.title: Amount of vulnerabilities by machine

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), source = tostring(properties.additionalData.source), vulnId = tostring(properties.id), softwareName = tostring(properties.displayName), status = tostring(properties.status.code)
| where resourceId == "{resourceId}" and status == "Unhealthy" and source == "Built-in Qualys vulnerability assessment"
content.title: Discovered vulnerabilities per selected resource

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id), vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id), cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve, severity = tostring(properties.status.severity)
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| extend CVEID = tostring(cve['title'])
| where resourceId == "{resourceId}"
| where vulnId == "{vulnId}"
| summarize count() by severity
content.title: Total number of CVEs in selected vulnerability
content.noDataMessage: There is no CVE information associated with this vulnerability ID.

content.query:
securityresources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments/subassessments"
| extend assessmentKey = extract(".*assessments/(.+?)/.*",1, id)
| where assessmentKey == "1195afff-c881-495e-9bc5-1486211ae03f" and properties.additionalData.source == "Built-in Qualys vulnerability assessment"
| project resourceId = parse_json(properties.resourceDetails.id),
    vulnId = tostring(parse_json(properties).id),
    cve = parse_json(properties.additionalData).cve,
    publishedTime = todatetime(properties.additionalData.publishedTime),
    severity = tostring(properties.status.severity),
    cvss2 = tostring(properties.additionalData.cvss.["2.0"].base),
    cvss3 = tostring(properties.additionalData.cvss.["3.0"].base),
    description = tostring(properties.description),
    impact = tostring(properties.impact)
| mvexpand todynamic(cve)
| where vulnId == "{vulnId}" and resourceId == "{resourceId}"
| project vulnId, CVEID = tostring(cve['title']), cvss2, cvss3, severity, description, impact, format_datetime(publishedTime, 'yyyy-MM-dd, hh:mm')
| order by cvss2
content.title: CVEs per vulnerability ID
content.noDataMessage: There is no CVE information associated with this vulnerability ID.
